required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Examine the safety and effectiveness of Vfend [voriconazole] for prophylaxix use under general clinical practices.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
primary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. A serious ADR was an ADR resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions Not Expected From the Approved Local Product Document (Unknown Adverse Drug Reactions)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. Expectedness of the adverse event was determined according to the Japanese package insert. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions by Age
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician. Participants with ADRs were counted by age (<15 years, ≥15 years) to assess whether it was a risk factor for the occurrence of ADRs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions by Reason for Use
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician. Participants with ADRs were counted by reason for use to assess whether it was a risk factor for the occurrence of ADRs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions by Long-term Use
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician. Participants with ADRs were counted by long-term use to assess whether it was a risk factor for the occurrence of ADRs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Developed Invasive Fungal Infections (IFI Rate)
secondary_outcome.description: IFI rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who developed invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician. In case of "with onset," it was classified as proven diagnosis, probable diagnosis, or possible case according to the diagnostic criteria of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer/Mycoses Study Group (EORTC/MSG). Participants judged as proven diagnosis or probable diagnosis were counted as those who developed invasive fungal infections for the calculation of IFI rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Developed Invasive Fungal Infections (IFI Rate) by Age
secondary_outcome.description: IFI rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who developed invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician. In case of "with onset," it was classified as proven diagnosis, probable diagnosis, or possible case according to the diagnostic criteria of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer/Mycoses Study Group (EORTC/MSG). Participants judged as proven diagnosis or probable diagnosis were counted as those who developed invasive fungal infections for the calculation of IFI rate. Participants who developed invasive fungal infections were counted by age (<15 years, ≥15 years) to assess whether it contributes to the clinical effectiveness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Developed Invasive Fungal Infections (IFI Rate) by Reason for Use
secondary_outcome.description: IFI rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who developed invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician. In case of "with onset," it was classified as proven diagnosis, probable diagnosis, or possible case according to the diagnostic criteria of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer/Mycoses Study Group (EORTC/MSG). Participants judged as proven diagnosis or probable diagnosis were counted as those who developed invasive fungal infections for the calculation of IFI rate. Participants who developed invasive fungal infections were counted by reason for use to assess whether it contributes to the clinical effectiveness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Successful Prophylaxis of Invasive Fungal Infections (Success Rate)
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician, and participants judged as "without onset" were counted as those with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections for the calculation of success rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Successful Prophylaxis of Invasive Fungal Infections (Success Rate) by Age
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician, and participants judged as "without onset" were counted as those with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections for the calculation of success rate. Participants with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections were counted by age (<15 years, ≥15 years) to assess whether it contributes to the clinical effectiveness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Successful Prophylaxis of Invasive Fungal Infections (Success Rate) by Reason for Use
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician, and participants judged as "without onset" were counted as those with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections for the calculation of success rate. Participants with successful prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections were counted by reason for use to assess whether it contributes to the clinical effectiveness.

study_pop.textblock: The subjects who have been treated with voriconazole for prophylaxis of invasive fungal infections in patients undergoing HSCT (Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing HSCT (Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been previously enrolled in this study.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

group.title: VFEND (Voriconazole)
group.description: Participants who received VFEND as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 3 years at maximum. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

baseline.population: A total of 237 participants were enrolled in this study. Of the 237 participants, 4 participants were excluded from the safety analysis set due to the following reasons: Protocol violation (registration violation, 3; contract violation/deficiency, 1)

group.title: VFEND (Voriconazole)
group.description: Participants who received VFEND as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 3 years at maximum. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Reason for Use
measure.description: Primary prophylaxis: Prophylaxis in participants without history of fungal infection. Secondary prophylaxis: Prophylaxis in participants with history of fungal infection.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to VFEND in a participant who received VFEND. A serious ADR was an ADR resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to VFEND was assessed by the physician.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and had received VFEND at least once.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants Who Developed Invasive Fungal Infections (IFI Rate)
outcome.description: IFI rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who developed invasive fungal infections over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Presence or absence of invasive fungal infections was judged as "without onset," "with onset," or "indeterminate" by the physician. In case of "with onset," it was classified as proven diagnosis, probable diagnosis, or possible case according to the diagnostic criteria of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer/Mycoses Study Group (EORTC/MSG). Participants judged as proven diagnosis or probable diagnosis were counted as those who developed invasive fungal infections for the calculation of IFI rate.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set (EAS) comprised of participants in the safety analysis set for whom the presence/absence of invasive fungal infections has been evaluated, excluding those with no information on effectiveness or non-target disease. The EAS was 199 participants. Those assessed as "indeterminate (n=1)" was excluded from the calculation.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of adverse events. The same event may appear as both an adverse event and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as non-serious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both serious and non-serious events during the study.

group.title: VFEND (Voriconazole)
group.description: Participants who received VFEND as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of 3 years at maximum. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

event.sub_title: Acute graft versus host disease in intestine
Acute graft versus host disease in liver
Graft versus host disease in lung

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
